definition: firmly set on doing sth/to insist on doing/determined in one's course of action
hard/stiff/strong/firm/resolutely/doggedly/good (quality)/able (person)/(of food) filling/substantial
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to demand/to request/to coerce

sentences.english: They pressed gifts on their benefactors .
sentences.chinese: 他們硬要贊助人接受禮物。

sentences.english: He pressed the money into the man’s hand. The man tried to give it back, but my father insisted.
sentences.chinese: 男人想把錢推回來，但爸爸硬要他收下。

sentences.english: Phoebe invites herself, Ross, and Rachel along as well.
sentences.chinese: 菲比硬要拉羅斯和瑞秋同去。

sentences.english: To require them to use English is futile.
sentences.chinese: 硬要他們使用英語純屬徒勞。

sentences.english: It's also really annoying how they insist upon putting meat broths in vegetable soups.
sentences.chinese: 對於他們硬要在蔬菜湯里加雞湯，我非常反感。

definition: to want absolutely/to insist on (doing something)
(followed by a verb phrase, then – optionally – 不可, or 不行 etc) must
to insist on doing sth/must do it, despite everything
to be determined to/to insist on
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
just/simply/stubbornly/really
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
life or death/fate/no matter what/anyway/for the life of me
to bring trouble on oneself
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
(coll.) if

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
to think about it
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
to pressure/to press/to force/to compel/to push/to coerce/to urge/to impel/to bully into/to be compelled
